title: SUPERSEDE – SUpporting Evolution and Adaptation of PERsonalized Software by Exploiting Contextual Data and End-user Feedback

author: Jovan Varga, Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya

segmentation: OK, hello everyone, I'm your Varga postdoc researcher at University that we take in cataluna.
Anne, I'm going to present your project that I'm currently involved in, so it's supporting evolution and adaptation of personalized software by exploiting contextual data.
An end user feedback.
OK, So what does that mean I'm going to?
Give just brief details about the project so it's H 2020 project funded by.
The European Council and it belongs to tools and methods for software development started in 1st of May 2015.
In duration is for three years and we have.
So we have industry partners, small and medium enterprises, research institutions, an academic partners.
So what do we?
Do the focus of the project is that we provide methods and tools to enhance decision making for the evolution and adaptation of software applications and services.
So this means that we want to close the loop between software users and software developers.
So on one side, when we have end users, they provide their feedback about the software that they are using, as well as different type of data an that come.
For example from monitoring the software.
So we have.
Different parameters in this context that are being done.
We take both of these data sources and first there is the part of collection.
So gathering of all the data this data is forwarded to the data big data analysis platform.
This analysis has means to identify different kind of patterns and cross these different kind of data sources.
Once certain trends and patterns are identified, they're alerts are raised for the decision making component that where people are experts are able to analyze the feedback.
So what really happened?
What is really required, what users want to change, and then this is forwarded for the evolving and adapting of software component, which provides a release plans.
So release plans for the software developers this is.
Then again, new releases and users again use the software and provide their feedback.
It's important to have in mind that we provide two different kind of scenarios, so one is for dynamic adaptation scenario, meaning that there are some bugs or fixes needed when users complain.
So here we need to parse this.
Feedback and feedback can be in various multimodal forms and then again following the process there should be these dynamic updates.
Done in as soon as possible and the other scenario is the evolution meaning when users require a new feature required in their applications or which is not already there.
This again needs to be planned and supported by our tool.
So.
In this context.
So on one side we have, so we have users.
We have APIs or we have context coming from monitoring an context.
This structured monitoring semi structure and feedback on structure.
For example given in a text form.

This goes into a big data management and analysis component, so I'm focusing now on the use of our semantic web technologies in the context of our project and then so this is the second component on the previous slide, and here once the analysis is performed, we forward different kind of alerts and models for the decision making software.
In this context, we have designed an ontology, so this is metadata model.

So considering different types of arrays and sources in particular, we consider Jason files in this particular context that come in with all these data that are then being processed, we extract the ontologies from these Jason files, model them and enable users.
Then to define different kind of alerts that they want to detect so.
For example, there is more than five complaints within some time frame or something like that, so we are now also.
This is currently under work which will be related to all these concepts of feedback or monitoring data coming from the sources.
And thus so.
What we offer is a toolkit, so this is a platform where we have tools for this.
First feedback gathering of softwares that is integrated.
Then this gathered feedback and monitoring also monitors that are so also giving some data.
Then these data are then processed by by this big data platform big data tool and then we have decision-making where these different kind of.

Requirements can be prioritized and finally so planning of the source and release plans, so these are the main components and in this context then we are especially interested in different kind of use cases that could apply the whole toolkit or one of the components for their scenarios.
So any of your projects that might have some software releases, we would be very happy to hear and apply our tools to see how we can improve.
Anything and if this can help your process and your releases, so this would be a brief overview of the project an yeah I hope I sticked in six seconds remaining.
Thank you.
